system.description:
Marksmanship pertains to your skill with ranged weapons such as muskets, bows, or even throwing knives. It governs aiming, shooting accuracy, and handling firearms under pressure.

You make a Marksmanship test when attempting to hit a target at a distance, whether during a hunt or in combat. If multiple people are attacking the same target, you may transfer your successes to others, improving their chances of success.

Extra Successes Can Be Used To:

  • Increase Damage – Inflict additional harm on your target.
  • Called Shots – Aim for specific body parts to incapacitate or hinder the target.
  • Pin Down – Force the target to seek cover, reducing their mobility.
  • Suppress – Make the target hesitant to attack, reducing their effectiveness.
  • Ricochet – Hit multiple targets with a single shot, if plausible.
